DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying sample sputum tissue laboratory patient dysplasia cancer normal volunteer may help doctor identify learn biomarkers related cancer . It may also help study cancer future . PURPOSE : This laboratory study look biomarkers patient respiratory tract dysplasia lung cancer , head neck cancer , aerodigestive tract cancer normal volunteer .
DOC.brief_title: Biomarkers Patients With Respiratory Tract Dysplasia Lung Cancer , Head Neck Cancer , Aerodigestive Tract Cancer Normal Volunteers
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Determine intermediate biomarkers premalignant respiratory epithelial lesion , genetic mutation alter growth factor expression , patient dysplasia respiratory epithelium lung cancer , head neck cancer , aerodigestive tract cancer . Secondary - Establish tissue repository normal dysplastic respiratory epithelium endobronchial forceps brush biopsy tissue patient normal volunteer . OUTLINE : Patients stratify accord presence extensive severe dysplasia respiratory epithelium ( yes v ) . Participants undergo sputum cytology , white-light ( without fluorescence ) bronchoscopy , endobronchial biopsy . Participants also undergo endobronchial brushing bronchial secretion collection possibly bronchoalveolar lavage . Collected sample process hematoxylin , eosin , immunohistochemical stain analyze specific biomarkers . Unused sample store tissue bank . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 330 participant accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Meets follow criterion : Diagnosis extensive severe dysplasia respiratory epithelium Recruited SPORE Tissue Procurement Screening Project private academic physician ( patient moderate severe dysplasia ) Survived 1 aerodigestive system carcinoma â‰¥ 1 year Completely resect stage I nonsmall cell cancer Undergoing follow procedure : Routine panendoscopy patient head neck cancer Resection bronchogenic carcinoma Bronchoscopy diagnosis stag suspect lung cancer Subsequent bronchoscopy surveillance monitoring response endobronchial treatment patient prior highgrade dysplasia bad No dysplasia ( normal volunteer ) No asthma No lung disease No respiratory illness within past 2 week Patients suspect risk neoplastic lung disease undergo bronchoscopy differential diagnostic consideration may include multiple etiology infection process . PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : No clinically apparent bleed diathesis No known bleed disorder No anginal No clinically active coronary artery disease No multifocal premature ventricular contraction No poorly control congestive heart failure No myocardial infarction within past 6 week No cardiac dysrhythmia potentially life threaten Wellcontrolled atrial fibrillation rare ( < 2/min ) premature ventricular contraction allow No ventricular tachycardia supraventricular tachycardia rapid ventricular response No serious medical condition would preclude patient undergo bronchoscopy No acute bronchitis pneumonia within past 8 week except clinically prove possible result lung cancer No hypoxemia ( i.e. , < 90 % saturation supplemental oxygen ) bronchoscopy PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
